parents.subject: QFileInfo:avoid calling Win I/O APIs on disconnected mapped drives

commit.subject: QFileSystemModel: Report Network Drive Type on Windows
commit.message:
QFileSystemModel: Report Network Drive Type on Windows

With the patch, on Windows QFileSystemModel::type(const QModelIndex)
reports the type of file index on a mapped network drive as either
"Network Drive" or "Disconnected Network Drive" based on the connection
status of the mapped network drive.

Note: The patch has to work with the patch of "QFileInfo:avoid calling
Win I/O APIs on disconnected mapped drives".
(commit: 78b2c4bd081b0f99f794b9e2f58abb1166eeabf5)

[ChangeLog][QFileSystemModel] On Windows QFileSystemModel::type(const QModelIndex)
now reports the Network Drive type on mapped network drives.

Change-Id: I8b861a0b7d877264fb7ff87eaf12cda4b66f19dc

subject: bitcode.prf: remove bitcode flags from QMAKE_LFLAGS

messages.message:
Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

Nope. I specifically ADDED these to fix linker errors: https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/168597/

The real fix for the Objective-C++ thing is https://codereview.qt-project.org/#/c/185931/. Wait for the downmerge.

Patch Set 1:

forward merge ;)

we're struggling with b2qt integrations, so it's taking longer than it should, but it will certainly come.

commit.subject: bitcode.prf: remove bitcode flags from QMAKE_LFLAGS
commit.message:
bitcode.prf: remove bitcode flags from QMAKE_LFLAGS

The bitcode flags are compile time only flags, and should
not be used on the link line.

Adding the flags to the linker will cause linking errors when
building apps that contains objective-c++ source files.

Change-Id: I0b818bf80430dd16e0ed269e6fe952d7b192ed00

commit.subject: QDateTime: Add addMinutes() and addHours()
commit.message:
QDateTime: Add addMinutes() and addHours()

The ability to add minutes and hours to a QDateTime object is very
convenient. For anything shorter than a day, you have to manipulate
the QDateTime object with addSecs().

[ChangeLog][QtCore][QDateTime] Add addMinutes() and addHours() to
QDateTime

Change-Id: Ifb3f5392793294725101a5a6d755ba70ceec6fa8

parents.subject: QSFPM optimization in dataChanged: don't re-sort if the order didn't change

commit.subject: WIP: Introduce mkspec for web assembly
commit.message:
WIP: Introduce mkspec for web assembly

The mkspec and corresponding configuration adjustments make it possible to
build/link the modules in qtbase and run simple applications using the
stock emscripten compiler. Tested cross-compiled (-xplatform emscripten),
but theoretically possible as a native build as well (requiring some
binfmt_misc settings on Linux to run the resulting JS versions of host
tools with node)

*NOTE*: this currently requires passing -no-headersclean, as headersclean
crashes the compiler.

This was done outside of the wip/nacl branch because 1) we can use the new
configure system and 2) most of the nacl patches don't apply to emscripten
builds anyway.

As emscripten can be used to build for raw JavaScript engines (e.g. nodejs)
as well as web browsers, some differentiation between the compiler and the
GUI platform (HTML5) has been added. Furthermore, a hypothetical "html5"
QPA plugin has been referenced.

TODO:
  - test the new event dispatcher with the emscripten event loop
  - fix headersclean option
  - decide if we should disable pthreads support, as it requires Firefox
    and an experimental flag (see
        https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/SharedArrayBuffer)
    ... leading to either QT_NO_THREAD or an alternate implementation
  - break up the unrelated changes better (e.g. separate double-conversion
    patch)
  - provide better application/lib support for building dynamic libraries
    (currently, building an app links in the actual bitcode instead, and
    the ports libs are linked into the app instead of the correct Qt lib)
  - possibly improve the configure tests rather than selectively disabling
    configuration options unsupported by emscripten but for which the
    config.tests pass
  - check all examples, testcases, modules in other repositories...
  - benchmark performance

Change-Id: I80cfa53605896ec8430df0b34bc1bce2c775d97f
